Field Label: Please select all applicable symptoms or signs documented in any physical exam over the course of this child.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Bulging Fontanelle | 2, Convulsions/Seizures | 3, Conjunctivitis | 4, Coryza | 5, Cough | 6, Lethargy or Decreased Level of Consciousness (Including Coma) | 7, Diarrhea (Loose Stool) | 8, Difficulty Breathing | 9, Fever (Temperature ≥ 38.00C/100.40F) | 10, Maculopapular Rash | 11, Neck Stiffness | 12, Stridor | 13, Vomiting | 14, Wheezing | 15, Other

Field Label: Which of the following were noted as signs on the physical exam?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Bilateral Expiratory Wheezing | 2, Lower chest wall indrawing | 3, Nasal flaring | 4, Grunting | 5, Age-based tachypnea (respiration rate 1 month to < 2 months > 60 breaths per minute (bpm); 2 months to 12 months > 50 bpm; and above 12 months >40 bpm) upon admission | 6, Lung hyperinflation, either because the cardiac sounds were no longer dull, but hyper-resonant instead, or liver ptosis was documented (used to evaluate Bronchiolitis certainty of diagnosis grading) | 7, Fever documented at > 380C (100.40F) | 8, Unexplained hepatosplenomegaly (used for certainty of diagnosis grading) | 9, Sepsis-like illness unresponsive to appropriate therapy (used for TB certainty of diagnosis grading) | 10, Stridor (used for assessment of Croup and rules out Pneumonia) | 11, None

Field Label: Which one of the following physical findings were documented in this child? (Select all that apply)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Anemia as noted by presence of pallor | 2, Jaundice | 3, None
